page.title: 12VILLAGE SHOP-LT.GADDESDEN
page.content: Little Gaddesden Village Stores has been standing since nineteen forty eight. It was started by Harold Ward. It used to be at fifteen Little Gaddesden. The Village Shop also has a Post Office joined on to it taking up about a quarter of it.It sells drinks,fruit and vegetables,tins of food, sweets, icecreams, cards, wrapping-paper and occasionally toys and books.The Shop is open all day every day except for Thursday afternoons. The Post Office shuts at 1 o'clock on Saturdays and does not open at all on Sundays. It is run by Phyllis Mountfort and Janet Stinton: the latter used to have a shop begun by her Grandfather and this was in Ringshall. Then the two shops combined. Daily and Sunday newspapers are delivered from the shop: an extra charge of 25p is made for delivery.
